page.title: 02LANDSCAPE OF THE AREA
page.content:
The area is hilly, much of it being over 300m above sea level. Many small valleys cut into the hills and there is some woodland on the slopes of the valley sides.
There is only one 'main' road, the B 3190 running north to south through the area, the other roads are narrow and twisting with the traditional high Devon banks on both sides. These are high earth banks often with a hedge or trees planted on top. This makes driving along them quite difficult because there are many 'blind' corners. In the winter these deeply set roads fill with snow but in summer they are quite different. In July the banks are covered with wild flowers such as foxgloves and the air between them is warm and full of the smell of summer.
